context: George Brown College conducts security audits, threat and risk assessments, Hazard Identifications and Risk Assessments (HIRA’s), establishes college-wide emergency procedures, manages Emergency Operations Centers (EOC), coordinates the Emergency Response Team (E.R.T.), and introduces the Emergency Notification System (ENS) as part of its emergency preparedness. The ERT is authorized to manage all emergencies impacting the campuses with security personnel serving as first responders, and First Aid and Plant personnel assisting when necessary. Regular emergency exercises are conducted on all campuses for training purposes. The emergency plan design is based on CSA Z1600 protocols. To access emergency procedures, visit Emergency Procedures. For inquiries, contact ask.george@georgebrown.ca or call 416-415-2000 (TTY: 1-877-515-5559). For college news and updates, sign up on the website. The information provided is subject to change without notice.
